description: French varech; of Teutonic origin. See wrack and compare vraic.

entries.meaning: The calcined ash of coarse seaweed, used for the manufacture of soda and iodine.
examples: Potash was scarce because of the Napoleonic Wars (1803â€“1815), and Bernard Courtois had resorted to varec imported from the Brittany and Normandy seacoasts [5].
